citation.title: Solution structure of the C4-type zinc finger domain from human peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor delta.

comment.text: Ligand-activated transcription factor. Receptor that binds peroxisome proliferators such as hypolipidemic drugs and fatty acids. Has a preference for poly-unsaturated fatty acids, such as gamma-linoleic acid and eicosapentanoic acid. Once activated by a ligand, the receptor binds to promoter elements of target genes. Regulates the peroxisomal beta-oxidation pathway of fatty acids. Functions as transcription activator for the acyl-CoA oxidase gene. Decreases expression of NPC1L1 once activated by a ligand.
Heterodimer with the retinoid X receptor.
Ubiquitous with maximal levels in placenta and skeletal muscle.
Belongs to the nuclear hormone receptor family. NR1 subfamily.

comment.name: Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology and Haematology
